segment.source: Set a Default Template
segment.target: Set a Default Template

segment.source: Set a Default Template
segment.target: Set a Default Template

segment.source: Set a Default Template
segment.target: Set a Default Template

segment.source: As an Editor, you can specify which of the available templates will be the default template suggested for all Group Policy administrators creating new Group Policy objects (GPOs).
segment.target: As an Editor, you can specify which of the available templates will be the default template suggested for all Group Policy administrators creating new Group Policy objects (GPOs).

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: A template is an uneditable, static version of a GPO for use as a starting point for creating new, editable GPOs.
segment.target: A template is an uneditable, static version of a GPO for use as a starting point for creating new, editable GPOs.

segment.source: A user account with the Editor or AGPM Administrator (Full Control) role or necessary permissions in Advanced Group Policy Management is required to complete this procedure.
segment.target: A user account with the Editor or AGPM Administrator (Full Control) role or necessary permissions in Advanced Group Policy Management is required to complete this procedure.

segment.source: Review the details in "Additional considerations" in this topic.
segment.target: Review the details in "Additional considerations" in this topic.

segment.source: To set the default template for use when creating new GPOs
segment.target: To set the default template for use when creating new GPOs

segment.source: In the Group Policy Management Console tree, click Change Control in the forest and domain in which you want to manage GPOs.
segment.target: In the Group Policy Management Console tree, click Change Control in the forest and domain in which you want to manage GPOs.

segment.source: On the Contents tab in the details pane, click the Templates tab to display available templates.
segment.target: On the Contents tab in the details pane, click the Templates tab to display available templates.

segment.source: Right-click the template that you want to set as the default, and then click Set as Default.
segment.target: Right-click the template that you want to set as the default, and then click Set as Default.

segment.source: Click Yes to confirm.
segment.target: Click Yes to confirm.

segment.source: When the Progress window indicates that overall progress is complete, click Close.
segment.target: When the Progress window indicates that overall progress is complete, click Close.

segment.source: The default template has a blue icon and the state is identified as Template (default) on the Templates tab.
segment.target: The default template has a blue icon and the state is identified as Template (default) on the Templates tab.

segment.source: Additional considerations
segment.target: Additional considerations

segment.source: By default, you must be an Editor or an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) to perform this procedure.
segment.target: By default, you must be an Editor or an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) to perform this procedure.

segment.source: Specifically, you must have List Contents and Create Template permissions for the domain.
segment.target: Specifically, you must have List Contents and Create Template permissions for the domain.

segment.source: After you set a template as the default, that template will be the one initially selected in the New Controlled GPO dialog box when Group Policy administrators create new GPOs.
segment.target: After you set a template as the default, that template will be the one initially selected in the New Controlled GPO dialog box when Group Policy administrators create new GPOs.

segment.source: However, they will have the option to select any other GPO template, including Empty GPO, which does not include any settings.
segment.target: However, they will have the option to select any other GPO template, including Empty GPO, which does not include any settings.

segment.source: Renaming or deleting a template does not impact GPOs created from that template.
segment.target: Renaming or deleting a template does not impact GPOs created from that template.

segment.source: Because it cannot be altered, a template does not have a history.
segment.target: Because it cannot be altered, a template does not have a history.

segment.source: Additional references
segment.target: Additional references

segment.target: Creating a Template and Setting a Default Template

segment.target: Request the Creation of a New Controlled GPO
